Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
CoinsListener, DisconnectedListener, InhibitedListener, IslandListener, MotherPositionListener, NoEntryClientListener, PlayedCardListener, ProfessorsListener, RestoreCardsListener, ServerOfflineListener, SpecialListener, SpecialStudentsListener, StudentsListener, TowersListener, UserInfoListener, WinnerListener
public class GUI extends javafx.application.Application implements TowersListener, ProfessorsListener, PlayedCardListener, MotherPositionListener, IslandListener, CoinsListener, StudentsListener, RestoreCardsListener, InhibitedListener, UserInfoListener, SpecialStudentsListener, NoEntryClientListener, SpecialListener, DisconnectedListener, ServerOfflineListener, WinnerListener
GUI class starts the graphical user interface. It loads all the scenes, receives the updates from the View class and calls the correct methods, and it allows the user to make specific action in each phase of the turn. In order to receive updates, it implements Listeners interfaces
See Also:
  • it.polimi.ingsw.listeners
  • Application

    specialStudentsNotify(int special, int color, int value)
     
    void
    start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
    Calls the first method of the game: based on the answer returned by proxy.first() calls the correct phase -SavedGame : a file save of an old game is present and the client is the first to connect, sets the scene to SAVED -SetupGame: the current client was the first to connect, so it can choose the number of players and game mode, sets the scene to SETUP -Not first: the client was not the first to connect, it can only choose its nickname and character, sets the scene to LOGIN -LoginRestore: there is a game save, but the client was not the first to connect, sets the scene to LOGINRESTORE
    void
    switchScene(String sceneName)
    Switches to the specified scene, keeping the same stage
    void
    userInfoNotify(String nickname, String character, int playerRef)
     
    void
    useSpecial(int special)
    Called from specialSceneController when a special card is chosen.
    void
    useSpecial(int special, int color)
    Called from specialSceneController when special card 1 is chosen.
    void
    useSpecial(int special, ArrayList<Integer> cardStudents)
    Called from specialSceneController when special card 7 is chosen.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Launches the GUI
      Parameters:
      args - of type String[]

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Calls the first method of the game: based on the answer returned by proxy.first() calls the correct phase -SavedGame : a file save of an old game is present and the client is the first to connect, sets the scene to SAVED -SetupGame: the current client was the first to connect, so it can choose the number of players and game mode, sets the scene to SETUP -Not first: the client was not the first to connect, it can only choose its nickname and character, sets the scene to LOGIN -LoginRestore: there is a game save, but the client was not the first to connect, sets the scene to LOGINRESTORE
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - of type Stage
      See Also:
      • Application.start(Stage)
      • SavedSceneController
      • LoginSceneController
      • SetupSceneController
      • LoginRestoreSceneController

    • scenesSetup

      public void scenesSetup()
      Called when the GUI is launched, loads all the scenes in advance and maps the name with the scene itself, and with its controller in two hashmaps. It also sets a reference to the GUI and Proxy in every controller

    • switchScene

      public void switchScene(String sceneName)
      Switches to the specified scene, keeping the same stage
      Parameters:
      sceneName - of type String - the name of the scene

    • phaseHandler

      public void phaseHandler(String phase)
      phaseHandler receives the name of the current phase of the game, and calls the correct methods
      Parameters:
      phase - of type String - the name of the phase to start
      See Also:
      • GUI.SetViewService
      • GUI.InitializeMainService
      • GUI.PlanningPhaseService
      • GUI.ActionPhaseService
      • loadScene(String)

    • useSpecial

      public void useSpecial(int special)
      Called from specialSceneController when a special card is chosen. It takes the number of the special and sets the action the user is allowed to make on the MainScene Actions allowed for the specials are: - special 1 : 3 - special 3 : 4 - special 5 : 5 - special 7 : 6 - special 10 : 7 - special 4 : 8
      Parameters:
      special - of type int - the index of the special (out of 12)
      See Also:
      • MainSceneController.setActionAllowed(int)
      • SpecialsSceneController
      • Special9or12SceneController

    • useSpecial

      public void useSpecial(int special, ArrayList<Integer> cardStudents)
      Called from specialSceneController when special card 7 is chosen. Sets the action the user is allowed to make on the MainScene
      Parameters:
      special - of type int - the index of the special (out of 12)
      cardStudents - of type ArrayList - the ArrayList of the students chosen form the card

    • useSpecial

      public void useSpecial(int special, int color)
      Called from specialSceneController when special card 1 is chosen. Sets the action the user is allowed to make on the MainScene
      Parameters:
      special - of type int - the index of the special (out of 12)
      color - of type int - the index of the color of the student chosen from the card

    • specialNotAllowed

      public void specialNotAllowed()
      Called from MainSceneController when the user tries to use a special card during its turn, but it receives "move not allowed" answer Resets the game to the last phase calling phaseHandler and setting the allowed action, resets the SpecialsScene
      See Also:
      • SpecialsSceneController.resetScene()
      • MainSceneController.setActionAllowed(int)
      • phaseHandler(String)

    • setGameRestored

      public void setGameRestored()
      Sets the gameRestored to true, if the game is already initialized

    • setNotYourTurn

      public void setNotYourTurn()
      Sets the actionAllowed to -1 in MainSceneController, meaning the player cannot perform any action, as it's not his turn
      See Also:
      • MainSceneController.setActionAllowed(int)

    • setConstants

      public void setConstants(String phase)
      Sets the given constant to true. If the constant is SpecialUsed, meaning the user tried to use a special, reset the SpecialScene
      Parameters:
      phase - of type String - the name of the phase
